intro: Memecylon papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Papua and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Memecylon papuanum is often found in moist, shaded environments within lowland and montane forests.
